author: sproul
content:
Sorry, I feel like we're always playing Docker tag across timezones üòÖ 

I've added Capella Docker builds to our CI which will be published at `sigp/lighthouse:capella` and `sigp/lighthouse:capella-modern`. This will stay up to date with the latest commit from our main `capella` branch with <1 hr of delay (for building the image).

```
docker run -ti sigp/lighthouse:capella lighthouse --version
Lighthouse v3.3.0-2c7ebc7
BLS library: blst-portable
SHA256 hardware acceleration: true
Specs: mainnet (true), minimal (false), gnosis (false)
```

Presently this includes the fixes for the payload reconstruction issues, but doesn't yet include the new bounded withdrawals spec which is awaiting review: <https://github.com/sigp/lighthouse/pull/3802>

author: ajsutton
content: For the record, if you're looking for the bounded withdrawals support, it's still in an open PR: https://github.com/ConsenSys/teku/pull/6593 Need to resolve an unrelated issue with the latest reference tests before we can actually get it merged.

author: parithosh
content:
To clarify scope of the Zhejiang testnet:
It'll have the following features: 
    Timestamp based forking
    Withdrawals
    Warm COINBASE
    PUSH0
    Limit/meter initcode

Aim: To allow the general public to start testing withdrawals and to start the process of finding larger scale issues. The allowing public part I guess is the part up for debate. We could alternately host another internal devnet, just bigger and it'll still allow us to bug-hunt - this approach would of course make the public testnet more likely a stable success. But I do believe there's a decent need for the community to start getting involved with withdrawals. 

CL: spec `v1.3.0-alpha.2`
EL: eip-4895 @ commit `0fa80ec`
EngineAPI version? - TBD
PR 314: getPayloadV2 in blockValue format : Yes, with 0 as a stub as a bare minimum.
PR 146(add getPayloadBodies method) & PR 218(getPayloadBodiesByRangeV1) NOT required
Genesis.json of EL has shanghaiTime as the field name

Option 1. Launch public testnet mid/late next week
Option 2. Launch private devnet mid/late next week
Option 3. Launch post vacation period

author: ajsutton
content:
https://github.com/ConsenSys/teku/pull/6614 will add support for reading local block value to Teku. It doesn't actually use it yet but that won't affect compatibility.

The version without block value will still be supported using our engine versioning setup - just specify `--Xee-version=NO_BLOCK_VALUE` and Teku will keep using the current version so can be made to work regardless of whether the EL uses the new or old format.
